alert.note: Alert for Hale; Lubbock; Swisher; Terry (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 30 at 4:21AM CDT until March 31 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 10 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR SWISHER, HALE, LUBBOCK, AND TERRY COUNTIES... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 10 PM CDT FRIDAY FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR SWISHER, HALE, LUBBOCK, AND TERRY COUNTIES... The National Weather Service in Lubbock has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from noon today to 10 PM CDT this evening. a Red Flag Warning has also been issued from 9 AM to 10 PM CDT Friday. The Fire Weather Watches are no longer in effect. * Timing...Noon to 10 PM CDT on Thursday. 9 AM to 10 PM CDT on Friday. * Wind...Southwest at 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph on Thursday. West at 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph on Friday. * Humidity...As low as 10 percent on Thursday. As low as 8 percent on Friday. * Fuels...Critically Dry. * Impacts...Any fires that develop can spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is discouraged.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
